base: LG.172 (Oct-Nov), LG.20, LG.101, El Adem, Martuba (Nov-Dec 1942)

sources: Imperial War Museum - Roy Marples DFC Collection (Tier 1/2)
RAF 238 Squadron blog - Operation Chocolate accounts (Tier 2)
National Archives - AIR 27/238 Operations Record Books referenced (Tier 1 - not directly accessed)
Wikipedia - No. 238 Squadron RAF (baseline identification only)
metadata.notes: Q4 1942 data based on Tier 2 sources with partial Tier 1 validation through IWM. Aircraft strength (16x Hurricane IIC) confirmed by multiple sources. Operation Chocolate (13-16 Nov 1942) well-documented with Squadron Leader Roy Marples commanding in Hurricane HL609 (KC-F). Squadron operated from multiple Landing Grounds during El Alamein pursuit. Personnel numbers estimated from standard RAF fighter squadron establishment (21 pilots, ~100 ground crew). Combat statistics for Operation Chocolate based on combined 213/238 Squadron claims (300 vehicles, 14 aircraft destroyed, 3 Hurricanes lost from 36 participating). Individual squadron breakdown estimated as proportional. Direct access to Christopher Shores' Mediterranean Air War volumes and RAF ORBs AIR 27/238 would elevate to Tier 1 (production_ready). Tier classification: 65% Tier 1/2 sources = review_recommended.

tier_1_sources: Imperial War Museum - Roy Marples DFC Collection
National Archives AIR 27/238 (referenced but not accessed)

research_gaps: Individual aircraft serial numbers beyond HL609
Exact casualty figures for the quarter
recommended_tier_1_sources: Christopher Shores - A History of the Mediterranean Air War Vol 2 (1942-1943)
National Archives AIR 27/238 - Operations Record Books Oct-Dec 1942
RAF combat reports - Second Battle of El Alamein
Air Britain aviation journals - 238 Squadron specific
